p: Six studies highlighted pregnant women's, midwives’, and nurses’ sources of support and support needs. Some pregnant women were supported by their spouses, obstetricians, midwives, and pediatricians to make sound decisions in times of need ( Lynch et al., 2012). Pregnant women wished to receive more information about the diseases or epidemics that they were living through ( Gomez et al., 2020) and better accessibility for timely healthcare services as their laboratory results were often delayed, which led to stress ( Gomez et al., 2020). The internet and social networks were preferred mediums to access such information. However, many women were concerned about the credibility of the available information ( Lynch et al., 2012). Pregnant women living in areas of lower economic brackets wished to receive special attention and support from the authorities ( Meireles et al., 2017; Gomez et al., 2020).
